metadata.feature_description: Get default settings for new pages based on parent or system defaults

steps.action: Navigate to Pages module and click Add Page button
steps.expected: Add Page form should open with system default settings
steps.actual: Add Page form opened showing default settings: Page Type=Standard, Parent Page=None Specified, Workflow=Content Approval, Display in Menu=On, Link Tracking=Off, Enable Scheduling=Off

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Get default settings with parent ID

steps.action: Click Add Page and select TestParentPage as parent from the Parent Page dropdown
steps.expected: Parent Page should be set to TestParentPage and settings should reflect parent context
steps.actual: Parent Page successfully set to TestParentPage. The Page Parent field in header shows TestParentPage and the dropdown shows the selected parent.

steps.action: Observe the Workflow dropdown in the Add Page form
steps.expected: Default workflow should be assigned based on system settings
steps.actual: Default workflow is 'Content Approval' which is the system default workflow for the portal. The Workflow dropdown shows 'Content Approval' as pre-selected.

steps.action: Click on the Permissions tab in the Add Page form
steps.expected: Default permissions should be displayed based on system defaults
steps.actual: Permissions tab shows default role permissions: Administrators, Content Editors, Content Managers have full permissions (all checkmarks). Everyone has partial View permission. Registered Users have partial View and Add permissions.

steps.action: Observe the Page Type options in the Add Page form
steps.expected: Standard page type should be selected by default
steps.actual: Page Type shows four options (Standard, Existing, URL, File) with 'Standard' pre-selected as the default page type.

observations: The GetDefaultSettings API endpoint in EvoqPagesController.cs accepts an optional pageId parameter (defaults to 0). When pageId=0, it returns system defaults. When pageId is provided, it bases defaults on that parent page.
Default workflow is retrieved using TabWorkflowSettings.Instance.GetDefaultTabWorkflowId(portalSettings.PortalId) which returns the portal's configured default workflow.
The EvoqPageSettings includes additional Evoq-specific properties like TabTemplates, thumbnail configurations, and workflow settings beyond the base PageSettings.
Template Mode defaults to 'Evoq Page Template' with multiple template options available for selection.
